item.description:
沙特阿拉伯和盟国正在考虑是否恢复每天 166 万桶的停产计划。【原文：

Saudi Arabia and allies ponder whether to resume a 1.66 million barrel-a-day tranche of halted output.

item.title: 德国不顾加沙批评向以色列购买军用无人机
item.description: 德国计划以近 10 亿欧元（12 亿美元）的价格从以色列购买三架苍鹭无人机，尽管欧洲盟国越来越多地呼吁向以色列总理本雅明-内塔尼亚胡施压，要求他停止在加沙的军事进攻。【原文：Germany plans to purchase three Heron drones for nearly €1 billion ($1.2 billion) from Israel despite growing calls from European allies to increase the pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to stop his military offensive in Gaza.】

item.title: 外国投资者对沙特股票下了更大的赌注
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯饱受打击的股票市场对外国投资者的吸引力与日俱增，因为其估值已低至谷底，而且投资者还押注油价不会再大幅下跌。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s battered stock market is looking increasingly attractive to foreign investors because of rock-bottom valuations and bets that the oil price won’t drop much further.】

item.title: 由 Eurazeo 投资的电动汽车充电公司看好欧洲的并购机会
item.description: 欧洲电动汽车超高速充电站的法国运营商 Electra 正在寻找机会收购欧洲大陆的资产，因为融资困难迫使整个行业进行整合。【原文：Electra, a French operator of ultra-fast charging stations for electric vehicles in Europe, is looking for opportunities to acquire assets on the continent as difficulty raising funds forces consolidation across the sector.】

item.description: 印第安纳州西摩，一名工人在组装柴油发动机的部件。摄影师：Luke Sharrett/Bloomberg【原文：A worker assembles components on a diesel engine in Seymour, Indiana. Photographer: Luke Sharrett/Bloomberg】

item.title: 印度财政部长表示印度将继续购买俄罗斯石油
item.description: 印度财政部长尼尔马拉-西塔拉曼（Nirmala Sitharaman）表示，印度将继续购买俄罗斯石油，这表明印度打算无视美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关于停止购买俄罗斯石油的一贯要求。【原文：India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the country will continue buying Russian oil, signaling its intent to defy US President Donald Trump’s persistent demands to halt the purchases.】

item.title: 法国农民推动阻止欧盟与南方共同市场的贸易协定
item.description: 法国最大的农业团体要求政府阻止欧盟与南美国家的自由贸易协定，并警告说该协定未能保护农业生产者免受廉价进口产品的冲击。【原文：France’s biggest farming groups asked the government to block a European Union free-trade agreement with South American countries, warning it fails to protect agricultural producers from cheaper imports.】

item.title: 任天堂为老角色发明新玩法
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，Takashi Mochizuki 和 Vlad Savov 将探讨任天堂在制作引人入胜的视频游戏方面的独特方法。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Takashi Mochizuki and Vlad Savov address Nintendo’s idiosyncratic approach to crafting compelling video games.】

item.title: 波兰寻求延长电力价格上限，以进一步削减费率
item.description: 波兰政府对迅速通过延长电价上限的立法持乐观态度，央行行长表示此举将增加再次降息的机会。【原文：Poland’s government is optimistic about quickly passing legislation to extend a cap on power prices, a move that the central bank governor said would boost the chances for another interest rate cut.】

item.title: 苹果即将发布 iPhone 17，开启全新设计时代
item.description:

item.title: 特朗普施压刺激美国与盟国的经济关系 — via Defense
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂（Chris Anstey），波士顿的经济学编辑，今天我们来看看美国的朋友和盟友是如何通过国防生产促进关系的。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston, and today we’re looking at how US friends and allies are boosting ties through defense production. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 消费者追捧牛肉，世界肉类价格再创新高
item.description: 由于美国和中国对牛肉的强劲需求，全球肉类价格在8月份创下新纪录，在全球牛供应不断减少的情况下，继续推动了长达数月的涨势。【原文：Global meat prices hit a fresh record in August as strong American and Chinese demand for beef continued to fuel a monthslong rally at a time when global cattle supplies have been dwindling.】

item.title: 特斯拉股东将于 11 月就 xAI 投资进行投票
item.description: 特斯拉公司股东将于11月投票决定这家电动汽车制造商是否应该投资埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）持有的人工智能初创公司xAI。【原文：Tesla Inc. shareholders will vote in November to decide if the electric carmaker should invest in Elon Musk’s closely held artificial intelligence startup, xAI.】

item.description:

US bond market is outperforming peers on the view that slowdown is taking hold.

item.title: 关键风险解除，Alphabet 在 3 万亿美元的惊人范围内
item.description: 在一项期待已久的反垄断裁决消除了数月来一直拖累 Alphabet 公司股票的一个关键风险之后，该公司股票突然摆脱了束缚。【原文：Alphabet Inc. shares are suddenly unshackled after a long-awaited antitrust ruling removed a key risk that’s weighed on the stock for months.】

item.title: Tether 通过增持加拿大公司股份扩展黄金战略
item.description: 稳定币发行商 Tether Holdings SA 正在通过增持加拿大一家黄金特许权使用费公司的股份来扩大其黄金战略。【原文：Stablecoin issuer Tether Holdings SA is expanding its gold strategy by adding to its stake in a Canadian gold royalty company.】

item.title: 美国银行称，在没有通胀冲击的情况下，美债走势可能已经结束
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的迈克尔-哈特内特（Michael Hartnett）认为，在没有通胀或经济增长冲击的情况下，美国债券市场的溃败很可能已经结束。【原文：The rout in US bond markets is likely over in the absence of an inflation or growth shock, according to Bank of America Corp.’s Michael Hartnett, who said a drop in yields will drive “unloved” stocks such as small caps.】

item.title: 几十年来最高收益率吸引买家购买波动较大的欧洲债券
item.description: 欧洲的长期债券在本周出现反弹，投资者抢购一些数十年来收益率最高的债券，使本周的大跌变成了购买狂潮。【原文：Europe’s long maturity bonds have rebounded after a whipsaw week saw a selloff turn into a buying spree as investors grabbed some of the loftiest yields in decades.】

item.title: 投资者追逐黄金矿商 ETF 反弹面临就业热检
item.description: 随着美国政府即将公布 8 月份的就业数据，押注黄金矿商的狂热涨势仍有上升空间的投资者将面临信念的考验。【原文：Investors betting that a torrid rally in gold miners has room to run face a test of their conviction as the US government gets set to deliver jobs data from August.】

item.title: 据说华润集团和海德堡是 NCC 工业部门的竞争者之一
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，全球最大的两家建材公司 CRH Plc 和 Heidelberg Materials AG 都是北欧建筑公司 NCC AB 正在出售的业务的竞购者之一。【原文：CRH Plc and Heidelberg Materials AG, two of the world’s biggest building materials companies, are among suitors for a business being sold by Nordic construction firm NCC AB, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 路透社称中国就腐败问题调查前市场部主任易纲
item.description: 路透社援引知情人士的话报道称，中国正在调查前最高证券监管官员易会满涉嫌腐败的问题。【原文：China is investigating its former top securities regulator Yi Huiman over alleged corruption, Reuters reported, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: BioNTech 称实验性乳腺癌药物试验成功
item.description: BioNTech SE 公司称，一种实验性药物在一项乳腺癌研究中获得成功，这是这家德国 Covid-19 疫苗生产商与中国生物技术公司 Duality Biotherapeutics Inc.【原文：BioNTech SE said an experimental drug succeeded in a breast cancer study, the first dividend of the German Covid-19 vaccine maker’s collaboration with Chinese biotech Duality Biotherapeutics Inc.】

item.title: 澳大利亚高价科技股本周跌幅创四月以来最大
item.description: 在估值达到一年前的水平后，澳大利亚科技股刚刚创下了 4 月份以来最差的一周。【原文：Australian tech stocks just posted their worst week since April after valuations hit levels last seen about a year ago.】

item.title: 普京称经济并未停滞，支持俄罗斯银行提高利率
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）拒绝了一位高级银行家关于俄罗斯经济正出现停滞迹象的警告，他支持中央银行通过将利率提高到历史新高来抑制通货膨胀的努力。【原文：President Vladimir Putin rejected a top banker’s warning that Russia’s economy is showing signs of stagnating, as he backed the central bank’s efforts to curb inflation by hiking interest rates to record highs.】

item.title: 人工智能需求强劲，英伟达合作伙伴鸿海销售额上升
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）的主要服务器生产合作伙伴鸿海精密工业股份有限公司（Hon Hai Precision Industry Co.【原文：Nvidia Corp.’s major server production partner Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. reported solid monthly sales growth, signaling demand for AI infrastructure remains intact in the US.】

item.title: Orsted 投资者在盈利预警后批准供股
item.description: Orsted A/S股东投票支持600亿丹麦克朗（约合94亿美元）的供股计划，而就在上周五，该公司刚刚发布了新的盈利预警。【原文：Orsted A/S shareholders voted to support a crucial 60 billion Danish kroner ($9.4 billion) rights offering, just after the company issued a fresh profit warning on Friday.】

item.title: 中国在调查后对欧盟猪肉征收临时关税
item.description: 中国对从欧盟进口的猪肉征收临时关税，此举将扰乱来自世界最大供应国之一的货物运输，并进一步加剧布鲁塞尔与北京之间的贸易紧张关系。【原文：China slapped temporary duties on pork imports from the European Union, a move set to disrupt shipments from one of the world’s biggest suppliers and further stoking trade tensions between Brussels and Beijing.】

item.title: 丹麦总督称丹麦应考虑用欧元加深与欧盟的关系
item.description: 丹麦央行行长表示，如果丹麦人希望在欧盟中发挥更大的作用，就应该考虑加入欧元，并暗示此举可以使丹麦免受全球动荡的影响。【原文：Danes should consider joining the euro if they want a bigger role in the European Union, according to their central bank chief, who hinted that such a move could insulate the nation from global turbulence.】

item.title: 伊藤忠出售日本首批橙色债券以促进性别平等
item.description: 伊藤忠商事株式会社出售了日本首批所谓的橙色债券，为性别平等项目提供资金，数据显示投资者对这些 ESG 票据需求强劲。【原文：Itochu Corp. sold Japan’s first so-called orange bonds to fund gender equality projects, and data indicated there was strong investor demand for these ESG notes.】
